paragraphs.original: OLIVIA$NEWLINE$Ay, my lord, this same.$NEWLINE$How now, Malvolio!
paragraphs.translated: OLIVIA$NEWLINE$Yes, my lord. How are you, Malvolio?

paragraphs.original: MALVOLIO$NEWLINE$Madam, you have done me wrong,$NEWLINE$Notorious wrong.
paragraphs.translated: MALVOLIO$NEWLINE$Madam, you’ve treated me badly, very badly.

paragraphs.original: OLIVIA$NEWLINE$Have I, Malvolio? No.
paragraphs.translated: OLIVIA$NEWLINE$I did, Malvolio? No.

paragraphs.original: MALVOLIO$NEWLINE$(handing a paper)$NEWLINE$(handing a paper)$NEWLINE$Lady, you have. Pray you, peruse that letter.$NEWLINE$You must not now deny it is your hand.$NEWLINE$Write from it if you can, in hand or phrase;$NEWLINE$Or say ’tis not your seal, not your invention:$NEWLINE$You can say none of this. Well, grant it then$NEWLINE$And tell me, in the modesty of honor,$NEWLINE$Why you have given me such clear lights of favor,$NEWLINE$Bade me come smiling and cross-gartered to you,$NEWLINE$To put on yellow stockings, and to frown$NEWLINE$Upon Sir Toby and the lighter people?
paragraphs.translated: MALVOLIO$NEWLINE$(he hands OLIVIA a paper) You did. Please have a look at this letter. You can’t deny that it’s your handwriting. Go ahead and try to write differently, and try to pretend that’s not your seal with your design on it. You can’t. So just admit it. And tell me honestly, why did you show me such fondness and asked me to smile at you, wear yellow stockings and crisscrossed laces for you, and be rude to Sir Toby and the servants?$NEWLINE$(he hands$NEWLINE$a paper)

paragraphs.original: ORIGINAL TEXT
paragraphs.translated: MODERN TEXT

paragraphs.original: And, acting this in an obedient hope,$NEWLINE$Why have you suffered me to be imprisoned,$NEWLINE$Kept in a dark house, visited by the priest,$NEWLINE$And made the most notorious geck and gull$NEWLINE$That e'er invention played on? Tell me why.
paragraphs.translated: And then tell me why you imprisoned me in a dark house after I followed your instructions perfectly. You made me look like the biggest fool that anybody ever tricked. Tell me why you did it.

paragraphs.original: OLIVIA$NEWLINE$Alas, Malvolio, this is not my writing,$NEWLINE$Though, I confess, much like the character.$NEWLINE$But out of question, ’tis Maria’s hand.$NEWLINE$And now I do bethink me, it was she$NEWLINE$First told me thou wast mad, then camest in smiling,$NEWLINE$And in such forms which here were presupposed$NEWLINE$Upon thee in the letter. Prithee, be content.$NEWLINE$This practice hath most shrewdly passed upon thee;$NEWLINE$But when we know the grounds and authors of it,$NEWLINE$Thou shalt be both the plaintiff and the judge$NEWLINE$Of thine own cause.
paragraphs.translated: OLIVIA$NEWLINE$I’m sorry, Malvolio, but this isn’t my writing, though I admit it looks like mine. It’s definitely Maria’s handwriting. Now that I think about it, Maria was the one who first told me you were insane. That’s when you came in smiling at me, dressed up like the letter said, and acting just like it told you to act. Someone has played a very mean trick on you, but when we find out who’s responsible, you won’t just be the victim, but the judge who sentences the culprit. I promise.

paragraphs.original: FABIAN$NEWLINE$Good madam, hear me speak,$NEWLINE$And let no quarrel nor no brawl to come$NEWLINE$Taint the condition of this present hour,$NEWLINE$Which I have wonder’d at. In hope it shall not,$NEWLINE$Most freely I confess, myself and Toby$NEWLINE$Set this device against Malvolio here,$NEWLINE$Upon some stubborn and uncourteous parts$NEWLINE$We had conceived against him. Maria writ$NEWLINE$The letter at Sir Toby’s great importance,$NEWLINE$In recompense whereof he hath married her.$NEWLINE$How with a sportful malice it was followed,$NEWLINE$May rather pluck on laughter than revenge,$NEWLINE$If that the injuries be justly weighed$NEWLINE$That have on both sides passed.
paragraphs.translated: FABIAN$NEWLINE$Madam, let me say something. Please don’t let squabbles ruin this beautiful and miraculous moment. I confess that Toby and I were the ones who tricked Malvolio because we hated his strict and heavy-handed ways. Sir Toby had Maria wrote that letter, and he married her as a reward. We should just laugh about the whole thing rather than get upset about it, especially if we consider that each of the two parties offended the other equally.

paragraphs.original: OLIVIA$NEWLINE$(to MALVOLIO) Alas, poor fool, how have they baffled thee!$NEWLINE$(to$NEWLINE$)
paragraphs.translated: OLIVIA$NEWLINE$(to MALVOLIO) Oh, poor fool, they’ve really humiliated you!$NEWLINE$(to$NEWLINE$)

paragraphs.original: ORIGINAL TEXT
paragraphs.translated: MODERN TEXT

paragraphs.original: FOOL$NEWLINE$Why, “some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrown upon them.” I was one, sir, in this interlude, one Sir Topas, sir, but that’s all one. (imitates MALVOLIO) “By the Lord, fool, I am not mad.”—But do you remember? “Madam, why laugh you at such a barren rascal; an you smile not, he’s gagged?” and thus the whirligig of time brings in his revenges.$NEWLINE$(imitates$NEWLINE$)
paragraphs.translated: FOOL$NEWLINE$Well, you know, “some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.” Anyway, I was part of the trick, sir. I pretended to be a priest named Sir Topas. But what does it matter? (he imitates MALVOLIO) “I swear, fool, I’m not crazy.”—But do you remember what he said about me before? “I’m surprised you enjoy the company of this stupid troublemaker—unless he’s got somebody laughing at him, he can’t think of anything to say.” What goes around comes around.$NEWLINE$(he imitates$NEWLINE$)

paragraphs.original: MALVOLIO$NEWLINE$I’ll be revenged on the whole pack of you.
paragraphs.translated: MALVOLIO$NEWLINE$I’ll get my revenge on every last one of you.

paragraphs.original: Exit
paragraphs.translated: MALVOLIO exits.$NEWLINE$MALVOLIO

paragraphs.original: OLIVIA$NEWLINE$He hath been most notoriously abused.
paragraphs.translated: OLIVIA$NEWLINE$He really was tricked horribly.

paragraphs.original: ORSINO$NEWLINE$Pursue him and entreat him to a peace.
paragraphs.translated: ORSINO$NEWLINE$Go after him and try to calm him down a little.

paragraphs.original: Some exit
paragraphs.translated: Some exit.

paragraphs.original: He hath not told us of the captain yet.$NEWLINE$When that is known and golden time convents,$NEWLINE$A solemn combination shall be made$NEWLINE$Of our dear souls.—Meantime, sweet sister,$NEWLINE$We will not part from hence. Cesario, come,$NEWLINE$For so you shall be, while you are a man.$NEWLINE$But when in other habits you are seen,$NEWLINE$Orsino’s mistress and his fancy’s queen.
paragraphs.translated: He still hasn’t told us about the captain. When that’s been taken care of and the time is right, we’ll all get married. Until then, we’ll stay here, my dear sister-in-law. Cesario, come here. I’ll keep calling you Cesario while you’re still a man, but when we see you in women’s clothes you’ll be the queen of my dreams, Orsino’s true love.

paragraphs.original: Exeunt all, except FOOL$NEWLINE$FOOL
paragraphs.translated: Everyone exits except the FOOL$NEWLINE$FOOL

paragraphs.original: ORIGINAL TEXT
paragraphs.translated: MODERN TEXT

paragraphs.original: FOOL$NEWLINE$(sings)$NEWLINE$(sings)$NEWLINE$When that I was and a little tiny boy,$NEWLINE$When that I was and a little tiny boy,$NEWLINE$With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$A foolish thing was but a toy,$NEWLINE$A foolish thing was but a toy,$NEWLINE$For the rain it raineth every day.$NEWLINE$For the rain it raineth every day.$NEWLINE$But when I came to man’s estate,$NEWLINE$But when I came to man’s estate,$NEWLINE$With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$'Gainst knaves and thieves men shut their gate,$NEWLINE$'Gainst knaves and thieves men shut their gate,$NEWLINE$For the rain it raineth every day.$NEWLINE$For the rain it raineth every day.$NEWLINE$But when I came, alas! to wive,$NEWLINE$But when I came, alas! to wive,$NEWLINE$With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$By swaggering could I never thrive,$NEWLINE$By swaggering could I never thrive,$NEWLINE$For the rain it raineth every day.$NEWLINE$For the rain it raineth every day.$NEWLINE$But when I came unto my beds,$NEWLINE$But when I came unto my beds,$NEWLINE$With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With toss-pots still had drunken heads,$NEWLINE$With toss-pots still had drunken heads,$NEWLINE$For the rain it raineth every day.$NEWLINE$For the rain it raineth every day.$NEWLINE$A great while ago the world begun,$NEWLINE$A great while ago the world begun,$NEWLINE$With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$But that’s all one, our play is done,$NEWLINE$But that’s all one, our play is done,$NEWLINE$And we’ll strive to please you every day.$NEWLINE$And we’ll strive to please you every day.
paragraphs.translated: FOOL$NEWLINE$(he sings)$NEWLINE$(he sings)$NEWLINE$When I was a tiny little boy,$NEWLINE$When I was a tiny little boy,$NEWLINE$With, hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With, hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$A foolish thing didn’t matter much,$NEWLINE$A foolish thing didn’t matter much,$NEWLINE$Because the rain it rains every day.$NEWLINE$Because the rain it rains every day.$NEWLINE$But when I became a man,$NEWLINE$But when I became a man,$NEWLINE$With, hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With, hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$People stopped talking to bad guys and thieves.$NEWLINE$People stopped talking to bad guys and thieves.$NEWLINE$Because the rain it rains every day.$NEWLINE$Because the rain it rains every day.$NEWLINE$But when I got married, ah, too bad!$NEWLINE$But when I got married, ah, too bad!$NEWLINE$With, hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With, hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$It did me no good to boast and show off,$NEWLINE$It did me no good to boast and show off,$NEWLINE$Because the rain, it rains every day.$NEWLINE$Because the rain, it rains every day.$NEWLINE$But when I had to go to bed$NEWLINE$But when I had to go to bed$NEWLINE$With, hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With, hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With idiots drunk out of their minds,$NEWLINE$With idiots drunk out of their minds,$NEWLINE$Because the rain it rains every day.$NEWLINE$Because the rain it rains every day.$NEWLINE$The world began a long time ago,$NEWLINE$The world began a long time ago,$NEWLINE$With, hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$With, hey, ho, the wind and the rain,$NEWLINE$But that doesn’t matter, our play is done,$NEWLINE$But that doesn’t matter, our play is done,$NEWLINE$And we’ll try to please you every day.$NEWLINE$And we’ll try to please you every day.

paragraphs.original: Exit
paragraphs.translated: The FOOL exits.$NEWLINE$FOOL
